entries.title: Facebook Is Bringing Back Trump
entries.description:
Donald Trump is coming back to Facebook and Instagram.

Read more...

entries.title: CNET Cops to Error Prone AI Writer, Doubles Down on Using It
entries.description:
After getting caught using an algorithm to write dozens of articles, the tech publication CNET has apologized (sorta) but wants everybody to know that it definitely has no intention of calling it quits on AI journalism.

Read more...

entries.title: In My Mother's Skin Tells a Frightful Filipino Fairy Tale
entries.description:
The only non-English language film in the Midnight section of this year’s 2023 Sundance Film Festival, In My Mother’s Skin is a gut-wrenching horror story about a girl placed in a desperate situation who makes a choice she quickly regrets. It takes place in the Philippines near the end of World War II, but its themes…

Read more...

entries.title: Android Users Can Finally Use Alternate Search and Payment Methods... but Only in India
entries.description:
Android users in India will soon have more control over their devices, thanks to a court ruling. Beginning next month, Indian Android wielders can choose a different billing system when paying for apps and in-app smartphone purchases rather than default to going through the Play Store. Google will also allow Indian…

Read more...

entries.title: A Truck-Size Asteroid Will Come 'Extraordinarily Close' to Earth Tomorrow
entries.description:
An asteroid is on its way to Earth, but don’t worry—the end is not here. The asteroid, dubbed 2023 BU, is about the size of a box truck and is not projected to impact our planet during its flyby on Thursday. However, it will be “one of the closest approaches by a known near-Earth object ever recorded,” according to a…

Read more...

entries.title: Tesla Is Making Record Profits, but It's Not Nearly Enough to Match Musk's Growth Goals
entries.description:
If Tesla was any other company, most analysts would think it a shining diamond compared to the hard time most other tech-related companies have had at the end of 2022. But this is Tesla, driven by the (cough) magnificent billionaire Elon Musk.

Read more...

entries.title: Will Poker Face Ever Explore the Origin of Charlie’s Power?
entries.description: Read more...

entries.title: Kamen Rider Kuuga Manga's English Translation Got Worse Between Previews and Release
entries.description:
Translating media from one language into another is always going to be a fraught process—from trying to retain a style and nuance between dialogue, to navigating fanbases that often perceive any kind of difference in localization as censorship. But there’s a difference between that, and what’s happened to Titan’s Kamen…

Read more...

entries.title: FBI Reportedly Investigates Fentanyl Distribution on Snapchat
entries.description:
Investigators are looking into Snapchat’s alleged role in fentanyl-laced pills being distributed through the popular video and messaging app. Bloomberg is reporting that the FBI and Justice Department’s investigation is part of a broader probe into the nation’s counterfeit drug problem.

Read more...

entries.title: Dungeons & Dragons & Novels: Revisiting Weasel’s Luck
entries.description:
For the first book in the Dragonlance Heroes series, The Legend of Huma, the story of the greatest knight in Krynn was told, and how he banished the Dragon-goddess Takhisis and saved the world. Now, in the third installment of the series, Michael Williams’ Weasel’s Luck, we have the tale of… some kid who’s primarily…

Read more...

entries.title: Revived MoviePass Could Be Open to All by Summer
entries.description:
MoviePass is back with a sequel and, counter to past fake-outs, this time it seems to be real. This past August, the movie ticket subscription service announced it was re-booting itself with a beta version that required advance sign-up to secure a spot on the waitlist.

Read more...

entries.title: We May Not Actually Need All That Lithium
entries.description:
Read any article about the clean energy revolution, and chances are you’ll run into some staggering numbers about how demand for lithium, cobalt, nickel, and other minerals and metals is projected to rise over the next few decades.

Read more...

entries.title: Google Is Screwed, Even If It Wins Its Antitrust Case
entries.description:
In 1982, the Department of Justice wrapped up a 13-year antitrust case against IBM. The DOJ lost, but so did IBM. The tech landscape changed, and IBM was distracted and had to move slowly under the increased scrutiny. Microsoft and Apple swooped in and knocked IBM off its perch. 20 years later, the same thing happened…

Read more...

entries.title: Check Out This Perfect Bear's Face on the Surface of Mars
entries.description:
On December 12, from 156 miles above the surface of Mars, the HiRise camera aboard the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter spotted a peculiar sight: the face of a bear, peering up from the crust of the Red Planet.

Read more...

entries.title: A MacBook Security Chip Is Giving the Secondhand Computer Market Hell
entries.description:
Digital recyclers are having a hard time breaking into secondhand Macbooks that have retailed for as much $3,000. The problem? The laptops won’t let anyone other than the owner log in even after a wipe, so now these perfectly good computers are being sold for scrap.

Read more...

entries.title: Hulu, Home of Solar Opposites and Koala Man, Has Also Cut Ties With Justin Roiland
entries.description:
Rick and Morty co-creator and voice actor Justin Roiland has lost another gig now that he’s facing felony domestic abuse charges. Hulu, home to Roiland projects Solar Opposites and Koala Man, has also parted ways with him.

Read more...

entries.title: Elon Quickly Finds Out Nick Fuentes Is Just Too Hateful for Twitter
entries.description:
After just one day after being reinstated back on Twitter thanks to owner Elon Musk’s blanket pardon of hate figures, white nationalist and anti-Semite Nick Fuentes has once again been kicked off the platform.

Read more...

entries.title: Critical Role's Mighty Nein Heads to Prime Video
entries.description:
Critical Role, the popular Dungeons & Dragons actual play that raised $11 million dollars a few years ago to bring its first campaign to life, will probably never need to resort to fan fundraising again. Amazon Studios announced a multi-year “exclusive overall television and first look deal” with Critical Role,…

Read more...

entries.title: Republicans Are Outraged Over a 'Green' Xbox Update
entries.description:
The right-wing outrage machine has moved on from gas stoves to a seemingly innocuous Xbox console update that focuses on power-saving features for lower energy consumption.

Read more...

entries.title: Mexico’s Maya Train Threatens Artifacts and Pristine Environments
entries.description:
Mexico’s government is building a new train project that could have big economic benefits, but the tracks are going to be laid at the expense of fragile ecosystems and indigenous artifacts, alarming the country’s environmentalists.

Read more...

entries.title: Dungeons & Dragons Quietly Announces a New Anthology
entries.description:
Today Dungeons & Dragons, a subsidiary of Wizards of the Coast, announced the next book in its quarterly publishing schedule: a heist-themed adventure anthology titled Keys From the Golden Vault. The book has been in production for years, and while its release date is unfortunately close to the controversy surrounding …

Read more...

entries.title: Could Mandatory Background Checks Curb Trust Issues on Dating Apps?
entries.description:
The vetting process on dating apps may become more stringent as governments around the world look at perhaps implementing mandatory background and ID checks for those who use the apps. Strategies and considerations of how to better protect people searching for love online were discussed at roundtable talks in Sydney,…

Read more...

entries.title: Shutterstock Has Launched Its Generative AI Image Tool
entries.description:
Shutterstock, one of the internet’s biggest sources of stock photos and illustrations, is now offering its customers the option to generate their own AI images. In October, the company announced a partnership with OpenAI, the creator of the wildly popular and controversial DALL-E AI tool. Now, the results of that deal…

Read more...

entries.title: Talk To Me Is Almost the Perfect Horror Franchise Starter
entries.description:
Social media and peer pressure can be powerful tools in modern society and both play a huge, horrifying role in the super smart and scary new film Talk to Me. Directed by YouTubers RackaRacka (real names Danny and Michael Philippou), this Australian horror film follows a group of friends who meet up to try this new,…

Read more...

entries.title: Webb Telescope Spectrograph Suffers Software Glitch
entries.description:
NASA says the Webb Space Telescope’s Near Infrared Imager and Slitless Spectrograph is currently unavailable for science operations following a software glitch earlier this month.

Read more...

entries.title: Amazon UK Workers Stage First Official Fulfillment Center Strike
entries.description:
Amazon fulfillment center laborers in the United Kingdom have launched the first company strike involving warehouse employees in the country’s history. The strike began yesterday in Coventry, demanding more than the 50 pence per hour wage increase that the company offered.

Read more...

entries.title: Asteroid-Mining Startup Plans First Private Mission to Deep Space
entries.description:
AstroForge has announced an ambitious commercial mission to observe a distant asteroid—an important step for the California startup as it strives to become the world’s first deep space mining company.

Read more...

entries.title: That Squid Game Reality Show Is Off to a Great Start as Contestants Play Red Light, Green Light in Subzero Temps
entries.description:
Contestants on the upcoming Squid Game reality show reportedly faced hardships that even the contestants of the satirical hit Netflix series didn’t even have to face. Reports out of the UK where filming for Squid Game: The Challenge is taking place noted sub-zero temperatures early this week, and contestants…

Read more...

entries.title: Large Study Finds Link Between Viral Infections and Future Brain Illness
entries.description:
Common viral infections may be having far-reaching effects on our brain health, new research suggests. The study found a link between dozens of different viral exposures and a later increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease and other brain disorders. More research will be needed to untangle the true role, if any, these…

Read more...

entries.title: Poker Face Joyfully Flips the Detective Genre on Its Head Thanks to Rian Johnson
entries.description:
Most typical detective shows are all about “whodunit.” The lead character pieces together clues to ultimately unmask a person who committed a crime. The new Peacock show Poker Face, however, takes that inspiration and evolves it. Each story, confined to its own episode, shows you who committed the crime in the very…

Read more...

entries.title: Terminator's Shape-Shifting Liquid Metal Robots Are Finally Here, But John Connor Is Completely Safe
entries.description:
Science fiction is often several steps ahead of the real world when it comes to conjuring up new technologies. Back in 1991, ground breaking visual effects helped bring the shape-shifting liquid metal T-1000 robot to life in James Cameron’s Terminator 2, but 32 years later, shape-shifting robots now exist in real like…

Read more...

entries.title: Can AI Help with Mental Health?
entries.description: Read more...

entries.title: Is Monica Rambeau Already Being Teased as the New Captain Marvel?
entries.description:
Jonathan Frakes has thoughts on the still very mysterious Star Trek: Strange New Worlds/Lower Decks crossover. Daredevil: Born Again gets a slew of intriguing new writers. Superman & Lois has found its new Lex Luthor in a Walking Dead star. And more, of course. Spoilers, spoil away!

Read more...

entries.title: TMNT: The Last Ronin's Ben Bishop Talks Designing Turtles for The Lost Years
entries.description:
Today sees the launch of TMNT: The Last Ronin - The Lost Years, a new anthology series looking back at the past and to the future of IDW’s beloved apocalyptic Ninja Turtles offshoot. But it’s not just a return for these beleaguered iterations of the turtles, but for Last Ronin artist Ben Bishop—and the continuation of…

Read more...

entries.title: Microsoft Outlook and Teams Are Coming Back Online After Worldwide Outage
entries.description:
It’s not just you. Microsoft 365 services, including popular apps like Outlook and Teams, are down in countries throughout the world. Microsoft is aware of the problem and has rolled out fixes to address it.

Read more...

entries.title: Are People Really Paying for Splash Mountain's Water?
entries.description:
On closing day for Splash Mountain at Walt Disney World, wait times exceeded three hours. Fans of the Magic Kingdom’s 1989 water log attraction gathered to say goodbye; among them were folks genuinely looking forward to the Tiana’s Bayou Adventure re-theme. Then there were the disgruntled extremists who were still…

Read more...

entries.title: FBI Blames North Korean Hackers for $100 Million Crypto Heist
entries.description:
The FBI says that cybercriminals connected to the North Korean regime are responsible for an attack on a U.S.-based crypto project, Harmony Protocol, that led to over $100 million in losses last year.

Read more...
